description: Test data for AVS Cortisol (Adrenal Vein Sampling for ACTH-Independent Cushing) Calculator

references.citation: Young WF et al. The clinical conundrum of corticotropin-independent autonomous cortisol secretion in patients with bilateral adrenal masses. World J Surg 2008;32:856-862
Acharya R et al. Outcomes of adrenal venous sampling in patients with bilateral adrenal masses and ACTH-independent Cushing's syndrome. World J Surg 2019;43(2):527-533

epinephrineValidation.description: AV epinephrine must exceed IVC epinephrine by >100 pg/mL to confirm successful cannulation

dominantSide.description: AV/PV cortisol ratio >6.5 indicates cortisol-secreting adenoma

contralateralSide.description: AV/PV cortisol ratio <=3.3 on contralateral side confirms suppression

testCases.name: Clear Left Unilateral Adenoma - All Criteria Met
testCases.description: Classic case of left-sided cortisol-secreting adenoma with successful bilateral cannulation and clear lateralization

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.name: Clear Right Unilateral Adenoma - All Criteria Met
testCases.description: Classic case of right-sided cortisol-secreting adenoma with successful bilateral cannulation

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on RIGHT side

testCases.name: Bilateral Hypersecretion - Low CLR
testCases.description: Bilateral adrenal hyperplasia with CLR <=2 indicating bilateral cortisol hypersecretion

expectedResults.interpretation: Bilateral cortisol hypersecretion likely (CLR <=2)

testCases.notes: CLR = 5.111/4.722 = 1.082 (<=2) indicates bilateral hypersecretion

testCases.name: Indeterminate Lateralization
testCases.description: Intermediate ratios that don't meet clear unilateral criteria

expectedResults.interpretation: Indeterminate lateralization

testCases.notes: Left AV/PV = 5.0 (not >6.5), Right AV/PV = 3.929 (not <=3.3), CLR = 1.273 - doesn't meet unilateral or bilateral criteria

testCases.name: Left Cannulation Failed - Epinephrine Below Threshold
testCases.description: Left adrenal vein cannulation failed validation - epinephrine delta <100 pg/mL

expectedResults.interpretation: Cannulation unsuccessful on left side

testCases.notes: Left Epi Delta = 120-60 = 60 pg/mL (<=100), cannulation failed

testCases.name: Right Cannulation Failed - Epinephrine Below Threshold
testCases.description: Right adrenal vein cannulation failed validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Cannulation unsuccessful on right side

testCases.notes: Right Epi Delta = 150-75 = 75 pg/mL (<=100), cannulation failed

testCases.name: Bilateral Cannulation Failed
testCases.description: Both adrenal vein cannulations failed epinephrine validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Cannulation unsuccessful on both sides

testCases.notes: Left Epi Delta = 80 (<=100), Right Epi Delta = 65 (<=100)

testCases.name: Multiple Left Samples - Averaging
testCases.description: Two left adrenal vein samples with averaging of valid samples

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Left avg cortisol = (80+90)/2 = 85, Left AV/PV = 85/11 = 7.727

testCases.name: Multiple Right Samples - Three Valid
testCases.description: Three right adrenal vein samples all passing epinephrine validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on RIGHT side

testCases.notes: Right avg cortisol = (72+75+78)/3 = 75, Right AV/PV = 75/10 = 7.5

testCases.name: Mixed Sample Validity - Some Pass Some Fail
testCases.description: Multiple right samples where only one passes epinephrine validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on RIGHT side

testCases.notes: Only sample 2 passes epi validation (480-55=425>100), so right ratio uses only sample 2 cortisol (95)

testCases.name: nmol/L Units - Left Adenoma
testCases.description: Test with cortisol values in nmol/L requiring unit conversion

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: 331.08 nmol/L = 12 ug/dL, 2621.05 nmol/L = 95 ug/dL, 965.585 nmol/L = 35 ug/dL (conversion factor: 27.59)

testCases.name: nmol/L Units - Bilateral Hypersecretion
testCases.description: Bilateral case with nmol/L cortisol units

expectedResults.interpretation: Bilateral cortisol hypersecretion likely (CLR <=2)

testCases.notes: 496.62 nmol/L = 18 ug/dL, ratios match TC003

testCases.name: Borderline CLR - Just Above 2.3
testCases.description: CLR exactly at threshold for unilateral disease determination

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: CLR = 6.9/3.0 = 2.3 (exactly at threshold, >=2.3 criteria met)

testCases.name: Borderline CLR - Just Below 2.3
testCases.description: CLR just below threshold - indeterminate result

expectedResults.interpretation: Indeterminate lateralization

testCases.notes: CLR = 6.8/3.0 = 2.267 (<2.3) - doesn't meet unilateral criteria

testCases.name: Borderline AV/PV - Dominant Side Just Above 6.5
testCases.description: Left AV/PV ratio exactly at 6.5 threshold

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Left AV/PV = 65.1/10 = 6.51 (>6.5 criteria met)

testCases.name: Borderline AV/PV - Contralateral Just Below 3.3
testCases.description: Contralateral AV/PV ratio just at suppression threshold

expectedResults.interpretation: Indeterminate lateralization

testCases.notes: Right AV/PV = 3.3 (<=3.3 met but CLR = 2.273 < 2.3, so indeterminate)

testCases.name: Epinephrine Delta Exactly at 100
testCases.description: Epinephrine delta equals threshold - should fail validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Cannulation unsuccessful on left side

testCases.notes: Left Epi Delta = 200-100 = 100 pg/mL (NOT >100, must be strictly greater)

testCases.name: Epinephrine Delta at 101
testCases.description: Epinephrine delta just above threshold - should pass validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Left Epi Delta = 201-100 = 101 pg/mL (>100, passes validation)

testCases.name: Suprarenal IVC Preferred Over Infrarenal
testCases.description: When both IVC values provided, suprarenal should be used

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Uses suprarenal IVC (12 ug/dL) not infrarenal (18 ug/dL)

testCases.name: Very High Cortisol Values
testCases.description: Extreme cortisol values representing severely autonomous secretion

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Very high left AV cortisol (250 ug/dL) with clear lateralization

testCases.name: Low Cortisol Values - Subclinical Cushing
testCases.description: Lower cortisol values in subclinical Cushing syndrome

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Lower absolute values but clear lateralization ratios

testCases.name: CLR Exactly 2.0 - Bilateral Threshold
testCases.description: CLR at bilateral hypersecretion threshold

expectedResults.interpretation: Bilateral cortisol hypersecretion likely (CLR <=2)

testCases.notes: CLR = 6/3 = 2.0 (<=2 indicates bilateral)

testCases.name: CLR at 2.1 - Between Bilateral and Unilateral
testCases.description: CLR in the gap between bilateral (<=2) and unilateral (>=2.3) thresholds

expectedResults.interpretation: Indeterminate lateralization

testCases.notes: CLR = 2.1 (>2 but <2.3) - in indeterminate zone

testCases.name: All Four Right Samples - One Valid
testCases.description: Maximum 4 right samples where only one passes epinephrine validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on RIGHT side

testCases.notes: Only sample 3 (Epi 480) passes validation (480-80=400>100), uses cortisol 85

testCases.name: High IVC Epinephrine - Still Valid Cannulation
testCases.description: Higher than typical IVC epinephrine but still achieves validation

expectedResults.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

testCases.notes: Higher baseline IVC Epi (150) but still valid: 520-150=370>100, 480-150=330>100

avPvRatio.note: Only calculated for samples passing epinephrine validation

clr.note: Only calculated when both sides have successful cannulation

avgCortisol.note: Average of samples passing epinephrine validation only

unilateralLeft.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on LEFT side

unilateralRight.interpretation: Unilateral cortisol-secreting adenoma on RIGHT side

conditions: Does not meet unilateral or bilateral criteria
epinephrineDelta <= 100 for one or both sides
cannulationFailed.interpretation: Cannulation unsuccessful - ratios cannot be reliably interpreted

edgeCases.name: Zero IVC Cortisol
edgeCases.description: Division by zero scenario - should return error or handle gracefully

edgeCases.name: Negative Epinephrine Delta
edgeCases.description: AV epinephrine lower than IVC (impossible in successful cannulation)
